title: Mensagem de Erro ao abrir
content: Prezado, Por motivo de saúde só estou respondendo agora. Primeiro gostaria de agradecer muito ao Senhor "Herbert May 18, 2024, 11:40:57 AM" que me deu atenção. Informo que segui suas orientações, mas não consegui resolver. Agora mesmo mostrou a mesma mensagem. Onde o Senhor orienta para entrar no "Gerenciador...ou pressionar Ctrl+Shift+Esc", no "Gerenciador aberto não existe "...processo do Firefox na lista..." Isso é um erro correto? Quando dá a mensagem e abro o Gerenciador ai, mostra só "Firefox ", e clicando com o lado direito e, em seguida encerrar tarefa ai fecha. Isso é o mesmo que clicar OK na tela da mensagem. Não mostrar no G.Tarefa "Firefox" tem algum erro no meu Windows 10? (não informei a primeira postagem). Herbert obrigado e se for possível fico aguardando uma resposta.
creator: TeixeiraCarlos

title: Login suddenly not working on one website
content: Suddenly, my login (user name & password) is not working on only one specific website, although it works perfectly with a couple other browsers. The site acts as though the information is not even being submitted-no change in site nor the "Login" button. I'm using the latest version of Firefox on Windows 10 and I have deleted all previous cookies and data, rebooted my PC with no difference in results. Thank you for any information.

title: Problem on mobiles (apple and Android) and PC (Windows)
content:
When we enter a search query on mobiles or on PC using Firefox we get:-

There was an error displaying the search results. Please try again.

This started happening today at about 10:45 (BST+2) Using Safari or the Galaxy search engine or using Chrome on the PC works fine.

At first we thought it might be a local problem so we re-booted our router - no result. We re-set Firefox on the PC - no result (anyway it is generalised).

Curiously WhatsApp is still connected (had to re-connect after re-set). So what is going on please?

Jon
creator: mouson

title: getting web pages
content: When I try and get a web page for example wordle or facebook I get following message 'There was an error displaying the search results. Please try again.' I have windows 11 on a laptop and am using duckduckgo as search engine. It has only started today and on Edge using same search engine I do not have the problem
creator: ynnepsetab

title: DuckDuckGo is down
content:
I use DuckDuckGo for my basic search engine on both my laptop (Ubuntu system) and iPhone 8. It does not work today - saying "There was an error displaying the search results. Please try again.", needless to say...I have tried a number of times and differed the searches to no avail. I also cleared recent cache/history. Still stuck. Searching on Chrome I see on https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=40451490 that others are also experiencing this problem and do not understand it either - just a few entries

The Sun (a rather populist newspaper in UK) has an article saying it is international and happening today, 23 May 2024, suggests no fixes. (Not exactly a reliable source in my thing)

Has anyone ideas or should I just wait and use an alternative search engine meanwhile? Thanks for any help
creator: b17m

title: Font look strange with large spaces when privacy.resistFingerprinting is set to true
content:
Hello! Browser version: 126 OS: Kubuntu 24.04 LTS. How to recreate: Set privacy.resistFingerprinting to true while running Kubuntu 24.04, enter a webpage like Wikipedia.

When I have privacy.resistFingerprinting set to true it breaks websites fonts (see picture). This problem occurred when I upgraded to Kubuntu 24.04 LTS.

I get the following console error that might be of interest: "Request for font "Noto Sans" blocked at visibility level 1 (requires 2)" To fix this, I tried to set the following prefs to 2 without success: user_pref("layout.css.font-visibility.private", 2); user_pref("layout.css.font-visibility.standard", 2); user_pref("layout.css.font-visibility.trackingprotection", 2);


I ran the following command, after trying to find a solution:

for i in $(echo verdana,arial,helvetica,sans-serif | tr ',' ' '); do fc-match $i; done

and I got the following results:

NotoSans-Regular.ttf: "Noto Sans" "Regular" LiberationSans-Regular.ttf: "Liberation Sans" "Regular" NimbusSans-Regular.otf: "Nimbus Sans" "Regular" NotoSans-Regular.ttf: "Noto Sans" "Regular"

Which seems normal to me.

Is there some way to fix this without having to disable privacy.resistFingerprinting?
creator: Bad_Username

title: Non si apre una pagina
content:
Buongiorno, chiedo cortesemente un aiuto perché dopo tanti anni che utilizzo Mozilla, da ieri sera non mi si carica e non si apre più una pagina di Amazon di lavoro. Il link è questo:

https://sellercentral.amazon.it/ap/signin?clientContext=257-4660479-5358727&openid.pape.max_auth_age=900&openid.return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsellercentral.amazon.it%2Finventory%2Fref%3Dxx_invmgr_favb_xx%3Ftbla_myitable%3Dsort%3A%257B%2522sortOrder%2522%253A%2522DESCENDING%2522%257D%3Bsearch%3A977770%3Bpagination%3A1%3B&openid.identity=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.assoc_handle=sc_it_amazon_v2&openid.mode=checkid_setup&openid.claimed_id=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.ns=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0&mons_redirect=sign_in

con altri Browser si apre ma io sono 15 anni che utlizzo Mozilla e mi sembra incredibile. Il resto funziona tutto. Grazie, saluti.

title: Can no longer detach tabs in Firefox 126
content:
Tab detachment was working fine until updating to Firefox 126. Now the tabs cannot be moved, detached or dragged to another window.

In about:config, browser.tabs.allowTabDetach is set to true

Suggestions?

title: Cannot drag tab to detach it from the current window
content:
After updating to the current version of my OS(listed below) I can no longer drag a tab to detach it from the firefox window. Doing so drags a preview of the tab, but it is never separated from the current window. I can drag it to an already existing window to move tabs from one window to another, but not to create a new window from a single tab.

OS: Manjaro Linux 24.0.0 Wynsdey Linux kernel version: 6.6.30-2-MANJARO (64-bit) Desktop Environment: KDE Plasma 6.0.4 KDE Framework version: 6.1.0 QT Version: 6.7.0 Display Server: Wayland Firefox version: 125.0.3 (64-bit)
creator: ejhallmark

creator: rechaugustoo

title: Translate Icon and Menu Item do not appear?
content:
I was browsing a webpage that turned out to be in Portuguese, and I was looking for how to translate it, but the internet indicated that Firefox has built in transation! However, neither the Translate Toolbar Icon nor the Translate menu option appear, even if I visit a site that absolutely should be translatable (https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozilla_Firefox)

Additionally, if I go to Settings -> General, there is a Translations section, but if I click the Settings button, there are no languages in any of the boxes and no option to add any.

I am on Firefox 126.0 for Windows.

Here are the things I have tried:

  • Restarting Firefox
  • Rebooting my PC
  • Disabling all my extensions
  • Running Firefox in Troubleshooting Mode
  • Clearing my Startup Cache
  • Performing a "Refresh Firefox"
  • Toggling and Untoggling browser.translations.enable and browser.translations.automaticallyPopup

Does anyone have any suggestions of something I could have missed?
creator: mpureka

title: Dark background
content: I am forced to switch over to the browser Brave, have been a true Firefox supporter but am unable to change the background from dark back to light, this has nothing to do with the computer desktop settings since Brave, Edge and Google Chrome all are still running with the light background. Please help since I find this unacceptable, have problems reading with the dark background. Regards, Art.
